description: From Medieval Latin reduplicātus, from reduplicāre, from re- with duplicāre.

adjectives.description: reduplicate (comparative more reduplicate, superlative most reduplicate)

entries.meaning: (botany) valvate with the margins curved outwardly
(botany) folded, with the abaxial surfaces facing one another

verbs.description: reduplicate (third-person singular simple present reduplicates, present participle reduplicating, simple past and past participle reduplicated)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To double again: to multiply: to repeat.
(transitive, linguistics) To repeat (a word or part of a word) in order to form a new word or phrase, possibly with modification of one of the repetitions.
